title: Security & Compliance Controls
subtitle: Control Framework â€” Data Protection, Access Management, and Audit Assurance

controls.statement: No personally identifiable information (PII) is collected, stored, or transmitted. All telemetry is aggregated and anonymized at the sensor layer.
controls.mechanism: Schema validation rejects PII fields; ingestion pipeline strips identifiers before normalization.
controls.evidence: Runtime validation report; schema definition in Appendix A; governance controls audit log.

controls.statement: Access to operational and governance views is restricted by role tier (Executive, Operations, Governance).
controls.mechanism: Three-tier navigation enforces view separation. Production deployment integrates with organizational identity provider.
controls.evidence: UI route structure; role-based navigation configuration; integration specification.

controls.statement: All system events, data fetches, validation outcomes, and demo mutations are recorded in a structured audit log.
controls.mechanism: In-memory structured log buffer with timestamp, level, and message. Exportable as JSON artifact.
controls.evidence: Governance Controls page; audit log export; logger module source.

controls.statement: Snapshot integrity is verified through runtime validation on every data load cycle.
controls.mechanism: Schema validation function checks required fields, data types, enum values, and array structures on each snapshot rotation.
controls.evidence: Validation results displayed on Governance Controls page; validation failure metrics.

controls.statement: All ingested data undergoes runtime schema validation before rendering. Invalid data triggers error state, not crash.
controls.mechanism: validateLiveState() checks all required fields, nested structures, and enum values. Failures are logged and counted.
controls.evidence: Governance Controls page; validation module source; metrics counters.

controls.statement: Model drift is continuously monitored by comparing current risk distributions against baseline thresholds.
controls.mechanism: deriveDriftStatus() computes drift from zone risk scores, camera health, and latency metrics.
controls.evidence: Governance Controls page drift status indicator; rollups module source.

controls.statement: All production data transport uses TLS 1.3 encryption. Demo environment uses local static file serving.
controls.mechanism: Vercel deployment enforces HTTPS. Local development uses localhost with no external calls.
controls.evidence: Deployment configuration; Vercel platform security documentation.

controls.statement: All code changes are tracked through version control with commit-level traceability.
controls.mechanism: Git repository with structured commit messages. Appendix A contract versioning for schema changes.
controls.evidence: GitHub repository history; Appendix A version header.

statements: No PII is stored, processed, or transmitted in demo or production data payloads.
Audit package export is available from the Governance Controls interface.
All data schemas are defined in Appendix A and validated at runtime.
Demo mutations are applied in-memory only and do not persist across sessions.
